data.title: Covfefe
data.solution:
s=input()
c="covfefe"
res=s.replace(([c]+sorted([(a,len(a))for a in s.split(" ") if a[0]=='c'],key= lambda x:x[-1]))[-1][0],c)
print(res if c in res else res+c)
data.statement:
In order to make your tweets more understandable, you need to replace the long complicated words by {{covfefe}}.

Given a [[tweet]], your task is to change the longest word starting with {{c}} to {{covfefe}}.
If no words starts with {{c}}, put {{covfefe}} at the end of the tweet. If multiple words start with {{c}} and have the same length, choose the last to appear in the tweet.

testCases.title: Normal sentence
testCases.testIn: I have good coverage of spray tan
testCases.testOut: I have good covfefe of spray tan

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn: This is the clearest explanation with good examples
testCases.testOut: This is the covfefe explanation with good examples

testCases.title: 2 matches
testCases.testIn: commonly, logical sectors per file allocation table ( corresponds with the old entry at offset 0x0B in the DOS 2.0 BPB).
testCases.testOut: commonly, logical sectors per file allocation table ( covfefe with the old entry at offset 0x0B in the DOS 2.0 BPB).

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn: je prefere carrement cafe clope caca
testCases.testOut: je prefere covfefe cafe clope caca

testCases.title: Two same length matches
testCases.testIn: On the morning i like some cofee and a clean desk
testCases.testOut: On the morning i like some cofee and a covfefe desk

testCases.title: Multiple matches
testCases.testIn: If only cockroach can drink coke while cooking celery
testCases.testOut: If only covfefe can drink coke while cooking celery

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn: The classroom is filled with curious students who cannot come early
testCases.testOut: The covfefe is filled with curious students who cannot come early

data.inputDescription: A [[tweet]] containing the words separated by spaces.
data.outputDescription: The string with the longest word starting with {{c}} replaced by {{covfefe}} or, if the string does not contain a word starting with {{c}}, the string with {{covfefe}} at the end

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In order to make your tweets more understandable, you need to replace the long complicated words by covfefe.

Given a tweet, your task is to change the longest word starting with c to covfefe.
If no words starts with c, put covfefe at the end of the tweet. If multiple words start with c and have the same length, choose the last to appear in the tweet.
Input
A tweet containing the words separated by spaces.
Output
The string with the longest word starting with c replaced by covfefe or, if the string does not contain a word starting with c, the string with covfefe at the end
Constraints
0 < Length of tweet <= 500
Example
Input
I have good coverage of spray tan
Output
I have good covfefe of spray tan
